column4: Anyone know about HT? My amdfx supports it, and im sure i read somewhere, that it needs to be enabled?
it is usually no worth it a lot.
is there no real performance upgrade?
in part because multiple threads means cache interference etc. But if you got the right app it can give around 30%. All you need is an SMP kernel.
I though smp was for duel processor?
HT is a form of dual processor...
any command to check the processor is ht enabled?
no idea. Try 'cat /proc/cpuinfo' and then look up the id string with Google and suitable keywords.
;) tytyty
no, SMP will even work on a single CPU
even if SMP sometimes is a bit less reliable then single processor.
BTW, have your got some spare cash? Because then there is a little upgrade you could try...
yeah... tell me more?
Intel have released a really cheap (relatively) dual core CPU, which is almost half the price of the cheapest AMD X2.
it is the Pentium D 820, and has massive cache etc.
sounds nice :]
that is a _lot_ better than HT
that surely does not have HT -- only Intel CPUs have HT
you could upgrade to an AMD X2, but they are very expensive. Also, your FX3500 is more or less as good as you can get, huge cache etc.
cheers :]
quick question: whats the best sound sys to use: ESD, ALSA, Artsd, or OSS?
